assessments.task_description:
Objective: This reflective assessment aims to explore your personal experience and insights gained from a specific creative writing lesson and exercise. Through this assignment, you'll reflect on your writing and learning practice and consider how it will impact your future writing endeavors.

Instructions:

  • Select a creative writing lesson and exercise from those we have completed in class.
  • Reflect on your personal experience with the lesson and exercise:
  • Describe what you attempted during the exercise and why.
  • Share any challenges you faced and any successes you achieved.
  • Analyze what you learned:
  • Discuss how your understanding of creative writing has evolved.
  • Highlight any insights or new perspectives gained.
  • Plan for future application:
  • Explain how you intend to incorporate what you've learned into your writing practice.

Please note that reflective essays can still make use of secondary sources–craft manuals, author interviews, essays, articles, and others, though they do not have to.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

assessments.task_description:
This secure assessment consists of two parts:

  • Submit a draft of your short story for workshopping (see the above assessment) and then lead a small group discussion about the feedback you have received
  • Complete an in-class reflection via Blackboard during the final 20 minutes of your workshop session

This pass/fail hurdle requirement verifies student authorship of creative work and engagement with the workshop process. To pass the course, students must successfully complete both components of this secure assessment.

Component 1: Workshop Participation To achieve a PASS, you must:

  • Attend the full workshop session OR complete an approved supervised make-up assessment
  • Demonstrate engagement with peer feedback on your work
  • Show evidence of authorship through discussion of your creative choices

Component 2: In-Class Workshop Reflection To achieve a PASS, you must submit a reflection that:

  • Responds to the prompts about the feedback you received
  • Demonstrates understanding of your own creative work
  • Shows thoughtful consideration of revision plans
  • Is completed and submitted via Blackboard during the workshop session

Assessment Outcomes

PASS Students who meet all criteria for both components will receive a PASS for this hurdle requirement and may continue in the course.

FAIL Students who do not meet the criteria for either component will receive a FAIL for this hurdle requirement, resulting in a grade of 1 for the entire course, regardless of performance in other assessment items. If you are at risk of failing the hurdle requirement, you will be invited to a follow-up interview to verify authorship and discuss your work. A PASS during this interview will constitute a PASS for both components.
